MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<TimeSpan> BatchAcknowledgementInterval { get; set; }

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment.

value.para: The amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment.

remarks.para: Other operations received and acknowledged during this time period will have their acknowledgments sent back in a single message.
Increasing the value decreases latency of individual replication operations but increases throughput of the replicator.
Default value is 0.05 Seconds (50 milliseconds)

summary.para: Gets or sets the initial size of the copy operation queue inside , which contains copy s not yet pumped and processed by the service.

value.para: The initial size of the copy operation queue inside , which contains copy s not yet pumped and processed by the service.

remarks.para: The default value is 64. Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Fabric.ReplicatorSettings LoadFrom (System.Fabric.CodePackageActivationContext codePackageActivationContext, string configPackageName, string sectionName);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Fabric.ReplicatorSettings LoadFrom(class System.Fabric.CodePackageActivationContext codePackageActivationContext, string configPackageName, string sectionName) cil managed
static member LoadFrom : System.Fabric.CodePackageActivationContext * string * string -> System.Fabric.ReplicatorSettings

public: static System::Fabric::ReplicatorSettings ^ LoadFrom(System::Fabric::CodePackageActivationContext ^ codePackageActivationContext, System::String ^ configPackageName, System::String ^ sectionName);

param.name: codePackageActivationContext
param.para: The current code package activation context

param.name: sectionName
param.para: The section within the configuration file that defines all the replicator settings

summary.para: Loads the object from the service configuration settings file.

returns.para: The loaded object from the service configuration settings file

remarks.para: The configuration settings file (settings.xml) within the service configuration folder generally contains all the replicator settings that is needed to pass in the object to the method. Typically, the onus is on the service author to read the settings.xml file, parse the values and appropriately construct the object.
With the current helper method, the service author can bypass the above process.
The following are the parameter names that should be provided in the service configuration “settings.xml”, to be recognizable by windows fabric to perform the above parsing automatically:

description.para: ReplicatorAddress or ReplicatorEndpoint – ReplicatorAddress should be of the form IPort. ReplicatorEndpoint must reference a valid service endpoint resource from the service manifest -
ReplicatorListenAddress or ReplicatorEndpoint – ReplicatorListenAddress should be of the form IPort. ReplicatorEndpoint must reference a valid service endpoint resource from the service manifest -
ReplicatorPublishAddress or ReplicatorEndpoint – ReplicatorPublishAddress should be of the form IPort. ReplicatorEndpoint must reference a valid service endpoint resource from the service manifest -

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<long> MaxCopyQueueSize { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int64> MaxCopyQueueSize

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum size of the copy operation queue inside , which contains copy s not yet pumped and processed by the service.

value.para: The maximum size of the copy operation queue inside , which contains copy s not yet pumped and processed by the service.

remarks.para: If this queue size is reached at the secondary, operations will be buffered in the Primary’s copy queue. If that queue also fills, then the Primary will begin seeing exceptions.
The default value is 1024

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum size of a message that can be transmitted via the replicator. These include replication messages, copy messages and copy context messages. The unit of representation is bytes.

value.para: The maximum size of a message that can be transmitted via the replicator.

remarks.para: The default value is 50MB

summary.para: Defines the maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside , which contains replication s

value.para: The maximum size of the secondary replication operation queue inside , which contains replication s not yet pumped and processed by the service. The unit here is the number of operations in the queue

remarks.para: If this queue size is reached, operations will be buffered in the Primary’s replication queue. If that queue also fills, then the Primary will begin seeing exceptions.
The default value is 2048.Note that values for this parameter must be a power of 2.
This setting is specific to the Replicator when the role of the service is Secondary/Idle

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<TimeSpan> PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout
Public Property PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> PrimaryWaitForPendingQuorumsTimeout { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };

summary.para: Defines how long the primary replicator waits for receiving a quorum of acknowledgments for any pending replication operations before processing a reconfiguration request, that could potentially result in ‘cancelling’ the pending replication operations.

value.para: Amount of time the primary replicator waits for receiving a quorum of acknowledgments for any pending replication operations when there is a request for the primary replicator to process a reconfiguration .

remarks.para: The default value is 0. This implies that reconfigurations aren’t waited upon for receiving quorum on the pending replication operations. This helps in completing reconfigurations sooner. Note that larger values for this parameter could potentially result in slower reconfigurations, implying longer durations to fail-over a primary.

summary.para: Configures the address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators.

value.para: The address that this replicator will use when communicating with other Replicators.

remarks.para: String is formatted as “hostname:port”, where hostname can be FQDN or IP address. The default value is localhost:0. If replicator is running inside a container, you should try setting up and .

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<bool> RequireServiceAck { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> RequireServiceAck
Public Property RequireServiceAck As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.RequireServiceAck : Nullable<bool> with get, set
public: property Nullable<bool> RequireServiceAck { Nullable<bool> get(); void set(Nullable<bool> value); };

summary.para: Prevents the optimistic acknowledgment of operations in non-persistent services by requiring that the service calls before it pumps the next operation.

value.para: true if the optimistic acknowledgment of operations in non-persistent services;otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Non-persistent services which require explicit acknowledgment can set this property to True in order to prevent optimistic acknowledgment of the operations by the Replicator. This setting has no effect for persistent services.
The default value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<TimeSpan> RetryInterval { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> RetryInterval
Public Property RetryInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.RetryInterval : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> RetryInterval { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };

summary.para: Defines how long the waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message.

value.para: The time needed the waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message.

remarks.para: Receiving a message does not necessarily that the message has been processed.
If this timer is exceeded, then the message is retransmitted.
The default value is 5 seconds.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations
Public Property SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations : Nullable<bool> with get, set
public: property Nullable<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations { Nullable<bool> get(); void set(Nullable<bool> value); };

summary.para: Typically, operations in the secondary replicator are kept in the queue to be able to catchup replicas if it is promoted to a primary. With this flag enabled, the secondary replicator releases the operation as soon as it is acknowledged by the user service.

value.para: true if the secondary replicator releases the operation as soon as it is acknowledged by the user service; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The default value is false
